gw.datatype

Interface IPersistentDataType


  • public interface IPersistentDataType
    Represents the persistence aspects of this datatype.
    Author:
    pdalbora

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object applicationToBean(Bean ctx, IEntityPropertyInfo property, java.lang.Object applicationValue)
      Converts an application value into a value suitable for storing on the bean.
      java.lang.Object beanToApplication(Bean ctx, IEntityPropertyInfo property, java.lang.Object beanValue)
      Converts a value, stored in the bean, into a value suitable for the application.
      java.lang.Object beanToJdbc(IEntityPropertyInfo property, java.lang.Object beanValue)
      Converts a value, stored in the bean, into its JDBC value.
      JdbcType getJdbcType()
      Gets the JDBC type associated with this datatype.
      int getLength()
      Gets the maximum length of values for this datatype.
      int getPrecision()
      Gets the precision for this datatype.
      int getScale()
      Gets the scale for this datatype.
      int getSize(java.lang.Object beanValue) 
      boolean isCharacterBased()
      Indicates whether this datatype is associated with a length.
      boolean isDecimalBased()
      Indicates whether this datatype is associated with a precision and scale.
      boolean isEncrypted()
      Indicates whether this datatype represents an encrypted value.
      boolean isPrimaryKey()
      Indicates whether this datatype represents a primary key.
      java.lang.Object jdbcToBean(IEntityPropertyInfo property, java.lang.Object jdbcValue)
      Converts a JDBC value into a value suitable for storing on the bean.
      java.lang.String toSqlLiteral(java.lang.Object applicationValue)
      Formats an application value as a SQL literal.

      • isCharacterBased

        boolean isCharacterBased()
        Indicates whether this datatype is associated with a length.

      • getLength

        int getLength()
        Gets the maximum length of values for this datatype. Throws an exception if this datatype is not string based.
        See Also:
        isCharacterBased()

      • isDecimalBased

        boolean isDecimalBased()
        Indicates whether this datatype is associated with a precision and scale.

      • getPrecision

        int getPrecision()
        Gets the precision for this datatype. The precision is the maximum number of decimal digits that can be used to represent values for this datatype. Throws an exception if this datatype is not decimal based.
        See Also:
        isDecimalBased()

      • getScale

        int getScale()
        Gets the scale for this datatype. The scale is the number of decimal digits to the right of the decimal point on values for this datatype. Throws an exception if this datatype is not decimal based.
        See Also:
        isDecimalBased()

      • isPrimaryKey

        boolean isPrimaryKey()
        Indicates whether this datatype represents a primary key.

      • isEncrypted

        boolean isEncrypted()
        Indicates whether this datatype represents an encrypted value.

      • getJdbcType

        JdbcType getJdbcType()
        Gets the JDBC type associated with this datatype.

      • getSize

        int getSize(java.lang.Object beanValue)
        Parameters:
        beanValue -
        Returns:
        the size of the given object of this data type
